main

Class ClypeClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ClypeClient

  • public class ClypeClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the user client.
    Author:
    Chris Carter, Jared Heidt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClypeClient()
      A default constructor setting the username to "Anon", the hostname to "localhost", and the port to 7000.
      ClypeClient(java.lang.String userName)
      A constructor taking a username and setting the default hostname to "localhost" and the default port to 7000.
      ClypeClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName)
      A constructor taking the username and hostname, with default port set to 7000.
      ClypeClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName, int port)
      A constructor taking the username, hostname, and port.

      • ClypeClient

        public ClypeClient()
        A default constructor setting the username to "Anon", the hostname to "localhost", and the port to 7000.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the client. It connects to the server, creates a client side listener thread, reads client data and sends it.

      • readClientData

        public void readClientData()
        Reads client data from standard input.

      • recieveData

        public boolean recieveData()
        Receives client data from the server.
        Returns:
        A boolean which verifies whether the connection with the server is to be closed or not.

      • sendData

        public void sendData()
        Sends client data to the server.

      • printData

        public void printData()
        Prints the received data from server to standard output.

      • connectionOpen

        public boolean connectionOpen()

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method scans the input arguments for a user name, host name, and port number. After obtaining this information, a ClypeClient object is created and its start() method is called.
        Parameters:
        args - Case (i): username e.g., java ClypeClient Sherlock Case (ii): username@hostname e.g., java ClypeClient Sherlock@192.168.23.45 Case (iii): username@hostname:portnumber e.g., java ClypeClient Sherlock@192.168.23.45:12415
